qnaDocuments.answer: Absolute poverty is the condition of having too little income to buy the necessities-- food, shelter, clothing, health care.
Affirmative action is the requirement that employers make special efforts to recruits hire and promote qualified members of previously excluded groups including women and minorities.
Alienation is the separation or estrangement of individuals from themselves and from others.
Apartheid is the recent policy of racial separation in South Africa enforced by legal political and military power.
Bicultural is the capacity to understand and function well in more than one cultural group.
Let's study sociology! Type in a sociology word(s), and a definition will be returned. For example, type "absolute poverty".
Minorities are people who possess some distinctive physical or cultural characteristics, are dominated by the majority, and are denied equal treatment.
Cultural pluralism is a pattern of assimilation where immigrants are allowed to maintain their traditional cultural ways while at the same time learning the values and norms of the host culture.
A stereotype is an over-generalized belief about a category of people. Stereotyping is, for example, believing that "all politicians are corrupt".
